file_content.text: You seriously weakened the rebels by executing those officers. I'll be listening carefully for any other signs of trouble.
My source told me what happened to those officers and their speeders. Done like a true virtuoso.
Maybe next time the rebels here consider an attack, this bloodbath will give them pause.
I doubt they'll forget this.
Might be too much to hope for, but let's hope nevertheless.
True--tell all your friends.
Gladly.
It's a pleasure working with such esteemed talent.
Whatever. Are we done here?
Yes... of course. I'm sure you have things to do. My thanks for your help.
Move quickly. These rebels can't get a chance to launch their attack.
Hey! I'm not some greenhorn. They ambushed us, and they did a blasted good job of it.
I don't pay on failed contracts, Randun. Keep pressing me, and I'll get moody. Got it?
I'm sorry you had to witness that, my lord.
Sorry for the drama, hunter.
Sorry to subject you to that, agent.
I'm sorry you had to hear that.
A kill operation of mine just got heroically botched, and now the Empire's paying the price.
Who do you need to eliminate?
Tell me about the operation.
What unfortunate souls were marked for death?
Tell me about the operation.
Sounds like an expensive mistake. I could probably fix that... for a price.
Failed missions can be costly.
An interesting prospect.
Sounds like a priority kill op. Who are the marks?
Brief me.
Imperial forces can cope with the occasional setback.
The Empire can handle it.
This setback might break our hold on Corellia.
Only a fool hires another fool to do a professional's job.
You're the one who fouled up.
If I thought he'd fail, I wouldn't have contracted him.
The targets are a group of rebel Corellian officers. They already bombed Incorporation Spaceport and destroyed a squadron of Imperial transports.
Hey, I did my best to stop that. These guys are elite CorSec. They chewed up my whole squad.
Translation: he failed. Now I hear they're rigging a bunch of speeders with explosives for another bombing.
Don't worry about this next attack--they'll never get the chance.
Leave this rebel scum to me.
Excellent. Execute the rebel officers and blow the rigged speeders at their camp.
That'll terminate their op and send a lovely message, don't you think?
Any idea about their target?
What are they planning?
None, and we can't wait for details. They've got enough explosives in those speeders to make the Spaceport bombing look like child's play.
You could always cut a deal with this riffraff and move on.
Just bribe them and be done.
We paid off most of the leadership when the occupation started, but this group won't deal. They're true believers...
...and these rigged speeders will make that Spaceport bombing look like a child's firecracker.
I can mobilize a new team in two hours. Platoon-strength, hardcore guys.
You had your chance. If you'd do me the favor of terminating these rebels and blowing the speeders at their camp, that'd be just lovely.
These rebels will die by my hand.
Their bombing days are done.
I believe a lesson in mortality is in order.
Their bombing days are done.
Excellent--the voice of true talent.
If you've got the credits, I'll do any favor you want.
As long it pays, sure.
Oh, I have the credits, hunter. You won't be disappointed.
Someday, rebels will learn it doesn't pay to cross the Empire.
Their bombing days are done.
I'm afraid you're more optimistic than I am. But your help is appreciated.
I could do this in my sleep.
Your confidence warms my heart.
Hey... business is business. One professional to another: don't get cocky.
Go do it yourself. [Refuse Quest]
Well, you've hardly made my situation any easier. I'll have to find someone else, then.
I'm afraid I'm waiting on some operational news.
